definition: to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
variant of 拖[tuo1]
surname Yan
to prolong/to extend/to delay
surname Shi
old variant of 時|时[shi2]
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: I can't permit you to temporize any longer.
sentences.chinese: 我不能允许你再拖延时间了。

sentences.english: People often use several well-known excuses to procrastinate.
sentences.chinese: 人们经常用一些人所共知的借口去拖延时间。

sentences.english: The opposition suspects Mr. Saleh's talk of stepping down is just an attempt to stall for time.
sentences.chinese: 反对方猜想萨利赫先生的讲话只是为了拖延时间。

sentences.english: One year, the losing side managed to drop the ball in a well to bide time.
sentences.chinese: 有一年，失败方曾设法把球投到一口井里来拖延时间。

sentences.english: The intervention would buy time for diplomacy to work.
sentences.chinese: 这种干涉是为了有成效的外交而拖延时间。

sentences.english: He stalled for time to wait for his friends coming.
sentences.chinese: 他拖延时间等着他的朋友的到来。

sentences.english: The speaker temporized in order to delay the vote.
sentences.chinese: 这个演讲者拖延时间以便拖延选举。

sentences.english: I was stalling for time to guess the correct answer.
sentences.chinese: 我开始拖延时间来猜测正确答案。

sentences.english: I don’t kill time or procrastinate with TV.
sentences.chinese: 我从来不用电视消磨时间或拖延时间。

sentences.english: They were widely criticized for feigning injuries to stop the clock.
sentences.chinese: 他们因为在球场上假装受伤拖延时间而受到广泛批评。

definition: to act with urgency/to buy time
delaying tactics/deliberate procrastination
to hold up/to hinder/to stall
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
reinforcement
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
to wait for an opportunity/to watch for one's chance
to escape/to flee/to run away
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
to look for a pretext
